claim: All of Snow White's dwarfs can play a game of 7 Wonders simultaneously.

supporting.text: There are only seven dwarfs in Snow White, and 7 Wonders requires a minimum of three players per game, making simultaneous play impossible for all dwarfs.

attacks.text: There are only seven dwarfs in Snow White, and 7 Wonders requires a minimum of three players per game, making simultaneous play impossible for all dwarfs.
The rules of 7 Wonders allow for more than one game to be played simultaneously if there are enough players and resources.
The dwarfs may not have enough resources or time to set up and play multiple games of 7 Wonders simultaneously.
The dwarfs are fictional characters, and their ability to play games is not constrained by real-world limitations.
The claim specifies 'all of Snow White's dwarfs,' implying a single game involving all seven, which 7 Wonders does not support.
The term 'simultaneously' could be interpreted as each dwarf participating in their own instance of the game, not necessarily all in one game.

supporting.text: The dwarfs have distinct personalities and roles, suggesting they may not all be interested or available to play the same game at the same time.

attacks.text: The dwarfs have distinct personalities and roles, suggesting they may not all be interested or available to play the same game at the same time.
The dwarfs often engage in group activities together, indicating they could coordinate to play a game simultaneously.
Even if they engage in group activities, 7 Wonders requires sustained focus and interest, which may not align with all dwarfs' preferences.
The dwarfs' teamwork and camaraderie suggest they could compromise or take turns to accommodate different interests.

supporting.text: 7 Wonders is a complex board game requiring significant attention and time, which may not align with the dwarfs' work schedules in the mine.

attacks.text: 7 Wonders is a complex board game requiring significant attention and time, which may not align with the dwarfs' work schedules in the mine.
The dwarfs have leisure time after work, as depicted in the story, allowing them to engage in activities like 7 Wonders.
The dwarfs' work in the mine is physically demanding, leaving them too exhausted for mentally intensive games like 7 Wonders.
Snow White could manage household chores, freeing up the dwarfs' time for leisure activities like playing 7 Wonders.
7 Wonders requires at least 3 players, and with 7 dwarfs, they can easily form groups to play simultaneously.
The dwarfs may not all be interested in or capable of understanding the rules of 7 Wonders.

supporting.text: The dwarfs live in a small cottage, which may not have enough space for multiple simultaneous games of 7 Wonders.

attacks.text: The dwarfs live in a small cottage, which may not have enough space for multiple simultaneous games of 7 Wonders.
The cottage may have a large common room or outdoor space suitable for playing multiple games.
7 Wonders is a compact card game that doesn't require much space per player.
The dwarfs are known to be resourceful and could rearrange furniture to create space.
Historical depictions of dwarfs' living spaces show they often have larger interiors than the exterior suggests.

supporting.text: Snow White's dwarfs are fictional characters, and their ability to play modern board games is not supported by the original story or adaptations.

attacks.text: Snow White's dwarfs are fictional characters, and their ability to play modern board games is not supported by the original story or adaptations.
The dwarfs are depicted as intelligent and capable of complex tasks like mining and singing, which suggests they could learn and play board games.
7 Wonders is a modern game with complex rules, and there is no evidence the dwarfs have the cognitive ability or cultural context to understand it.
The dwarfs' cooperative behavior in the story implies they could work together to learn and play a game like 7 Wonders.

supporting.text: The dwarfs' primary activities are mining and singing, with no evidence of them engaging in complex strategic games like 7 Wonders.

attacks.text: The dwarfs' primary activities are mining and singing, with no evidence of them engaging in complex strategic games like 7 Wonders.
7 Wonders is a simple game that can be learned quickly, and the dwarfs' intelligence is demonstrated by their mining and singing coordination.
Mining and singing require different skills than strategic thinking, and there is no evidence the dwarfs have ever played any board games.
The dwarfs live in a communal setting and likely engage in various leisure activities, including games, to pass the time.
